definition: to grace sb with one's presence/your arrival (honorific)/your esteemed presence
surname Jia
to harness/to draw (a cart etc)/to drive/to pilot/to sail/to ride/your good self/prefixed word denoting respect (polite 敬辞)
to face/to overlook/to arrive/to be (just) about to/just before

sentences.english: His servantannounced Mr. and Mrs. White.
sentences.chinese: 他的仆人通报怀特夫妇驾临。

sentences.english: Also, welcome to other distinguished guests and colleagues here at the Baha'i Centre today.
sentences.chinese: 此外，欢迎今天驾临巴海教中心的其他贵宾及同僚们。

sentences.english: This is the one and only time Henry is known to have visited Wye.
sentences.chinese: 据记载，这是亨利国王唯一一次驾临怀伊。

sentences.english: Today the Queen is honouring us with her presence.
sentences.chinese: 今天女王驾临，使我们不胜荣幸。

definition: we are honored by your presence
to visit/to pay a visit
to pay a formal visit/to call to pay respects/to meet one's senior or superior
to greet/to go out to meet
(polite) excuse me for not going out to meet you
Your presence brings light to my humble dwelling/see also 蓬蓽生光|蓬荜生光[peng2 bi4 sheng1 guang1]
to have an audience (with the Emperor)
call in (one's subordinates)/summon (an envoy of a foreign country) to an interview
to arrive (esp. of notable person)/to visit (more formal than 光臨|光临[guang1 lin2])
to have an audience with
to visit sb at home
to gather/to assemble
imperial chariot/(fig.) emperor/(polite) you
pay an official call/call on/visit in an official capacity
to go on an inspection tour
to pay a visit
